name: How to make homemade bread
author: NovaEraOfficial
tags: bread, bake, artisan, bun, baget, fresh, yeast

steps.step: Get 800g of all-purpose flour in a bowl.
Add salt.
Add dry yeast and mix with a spoon.
Add water and mix with hand until sticky.
Knead dough and cover with plastic wrap. Let rest 30 mins on the counter.
The dough will rise while in the bowl. That's good. Uncover bowl, flour surface and knead some more.
Once it's not sticky, cut dough into two pieces and conitnue to knead.
Use the fold technique to prepare the bun shape.
Preheat oven with a crock pot inside.
After 30 mins, carefully place the dough in the crockpot and begin the baking process. Sprinkle some flour on top, and slice the top of the buns to help rise.
Bake for 30 minutes with the lid on.
Take lid off pot and bake another 20 minutes.
Take pot out of oven and let rest 5-10 minutes.
Once cooled, separate bread and enjoy!

name: How to make banana cake
author: Cookist
tags: dessert, sweets, bake, baking, fast, easy

steps.step: Peel 3 ripe bananas.
Cut the bananas and add to a food processor.
Add 150g of sugar (about 2/3 of a cup).
Add lemon zest of one lemon
Add lemon juice.
Blend.
Add 100g of seed oil.
Add 2 eggs.
Mix again.
Pour mixture into a bowl evenly.
Add 250g all-purpose flour through a sifter.
Add one pack of baking powder (about a tablespoon).
Sift.
Blend.
Melt butter and coat inside of baking pan. This will help ensure the cake doesn't stick to the pan.
Pour mixture into pan evenly.
Shake the pan to help distribute batter evenly. This also helps pop bubbles inside the batter.
Bake for 40 minutes at 350 degrees.
Add icing sugar.
Cut, serve and enjoy!

name: How to make fried chicken
author: Tiffin Box
tags: chicken, fry, batter, kfc

steps.step: Add a half-table spoon of soy sauce to a bowl.
Add 1 tablespoon of ketchup.
Add 1 teaspoon of ginger paste, or a teaspoon of fresh ginger.
Add 1 teaspoon of garlic paste (garlic aoili also works as a substitute).
Add 1 teaspoon of black pepper.
Add a 1/4 teaspoon of salt.
Add a packet of ramen seasoning (optional).
Mix together to form sauce/marinade.
Add your chicken, skin on, to the bowl.
Mix chicken until coated well. Cover and let marinade at least two hours in the fridge.
Add 1.5 cups of all-purpose flour to an empty bowl or tray.
Add a 1/4 cup of corn flour.
Add 1/2 teaspoon of salt.
Add 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder.
Add 1/2 tablespoon of chili powder.
Add a 1/4 teaspoon of turmeric powder.
Mix.
Add chicken to dry mixture and coat thoroughly.
Once coated, dip chicken into cold water for a few seconds.
Take chicken from cold water and add to dry mixture again and coat thoroughly for a second time.
Heat oil on high. Make sure chicken is coated well and not wet. Putting water on hot oil can cause a fire. Cook with caution.
Don't overcrowd the pot. Cook only a few pieces at at time.
Cook until golden brown and crispy.
Remove chicken from oil and let cool.
Enjoy!

name: How to make pizza rolls
author: Pizza Time
tags: snack, tasty, cheese, cheesy, quick, easy

steps.step: Get 6 pieces of sliced white bread.
Add tomato sauce or pizza sauce to bread. You will need about a tablsespoon per slice of bread.
Add basil.
Add cheese. Low moisture mozzarella is preferred for a stringy goey effect.
Roll and wrap tightly in cling-wrap.
Put rolls in fridge for 30 minutes.
Add 150ml of milk to a bowl (A little over a half-cup).
Add 1 egg.
Add salt and pepper to mixture.
Unwrap rolls and dunk into wet mixture.
Heat oil on medium-high. Fry rolls.
Flip and cook all sides until golden brown..
Take rolls of heat and let cool for a couple minutes.
Enjoy!

name: How to make shrimp dumplings
author: Cooking With Eric
tags: chinese, pot stickers, pot-stickers, dim sum

steps.step: Get flour.
Add salt.
Add water and mix until sticky blob.
Sprinkle flour and knead into smooth dough.
Roll and cut into thumb pieces.
Flour and flatten nuggets into flat circles.
Roll into flat sheets.
Add 2 cups purple cabbage.
Add 2 cups chopped green onion.
Add 6 cloves garlic.
Add 4 tablespoons of diced ginger.
Add 4 tablespoons of diced ginger.
Add sesame oil.
Add soy sauce and mix.
Mix with ground pork.
Mix veggies with ground pork. We say eyeball it. Everyone likes different proportions at this stage.
Mix veggies with uncooked shrimp.
Mix veggies with uncooked shrimp.
Heat oil on medium-high heat and fry dumplings.
When they're beginning to on the bottoms, add a splash of water and cover with lid.
Take dumplings off heat and let cool.
Make a simple sauce with soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil and chili flakes.
Enjoy!

name: How to work out your core in 10 steps
author: Anonymous
tags: workout, abs, strength, fit, physique, shape, get in shape, summer bod, shredded, lean, muscle

steps.step: Start off with side crunches. Repeat crunch 1 minute per side for 2 minutes total.
Now that the blood is flowing, do rotational punches for 1 minute.
Core strength means having strong stability muscles. Try 1 minute of V-ins.
Do 1 minute of plank-ups, or hold plank for 1 minute.
In a controlled motion, rotate side to side with your legs and feet hovering just off the floor. Focus on your obliques for this exercise.
You're core is likely on fire. Cool off with simple crunches for 1 minute. Going slow is fine, just keep a steady controlled pace.
Take a breather so you can finish these last two exercises strong!
Alternate side to side and reach for your heels. Focus on your obliques.
The fun stuff. Scissor kicks for 1 minute.
Mountain climbers for 1 minute and you're all done! Amazing work. Now go find a guide to learn how to stretch!

name: How to get stronger hands in 3 easy steps
author: Fit365
tags: strength, hand, wrist, physiotherapy, physio

steps.step: Your hands have tons of little muscles. It's important to warm up and stretch them!
Squeeze a stressball, lacross ball, or hacky sack for 10-15 reps.
Use an elastic band and extend your fingers outwards. Use a thicker elastic band to make it harder if necessary. Repeat these steps once in the morning and once at night, 3 times a week.

name: Learn How to squat properly in 5 GIFs
author: Fit365
tags: squat, booty, leg, legday, leg day, quad, quadracepts, hamstrings, core strength, butt, glute, glutes, home workout, home work out

steps.step: Inhale as you bend your knees. Keep your arms out in front of your body for balance. Make sure feet and knees are shoulder with apart with your feet straight.
Ensure posture is correct, and hold squat for 1-2 seconds before standing back upright.
Exhale and stand, keeping your back straight as you lift yourself back upright.
Repeat for 30 reps, or until failure.
While holding for 1-2 seconds, try pulsing up and down to increase difficulty of squat.

name: How to get stronger ankles
author: Physio Physique
tags: strength, physio, physiotherapy, balance, stability, muscles, injury, injured

steps.step: Start with foot raises. Aim for 10-15 reps and focus on form, not speed.
Now try calve raises. Aim for 10-15 reps and focus on form, not speed. Use a chair for assistance if necessary.
Now sit and repeat calve raises. Focus on the slight variation in angle and muscles you're hitting.
While seated, do 15-20 inverse foot raises. Remember to hold for a second at the top.
Step on a resistance band with one foot, and with the other, extend outward for 10-15 reps.  Repeat for both feet and work on these exercises 2-3 times per week.

name: How to do a perfect push up in 3 GIFs
author: Anonymous
tags: pushup, chest, pecs, pectorals, summer bod, summer body, home workout, home work out, plyometrics

steps.step: Be mindful of your angle when in plank position. Make sure your arms are shoulder width apart and your body isn't too far over or behind your shoulders.
Don't round your shoulders. When learning new exercises it's best to focus on form, not speed.
Take about 2 seconds to go down, and 1 second to extend back up. Slow, down. Fast, up.

name: 5 supportive quotes for mental health
author: Creative Soul
tags: positivity, good vibes, good energy, mental health, mindfulness, wellness, state of mind, happy, happiness, wisdom, feels good

steps.step: Breathe in. Breathe out. You got this.
Small steps forward are still steps.
It's okay to not be okay.
All of the above :)
Stay strong.

name: How to meditate in 6 GIFs
author: Anonymous
tags: meditation, mindfulness, state of mind, positivity, zen, relax, calm, mind, mental health, clarity, rest, peace, inner peace

steps.step: Find a quiet place with no distractions. Make sure you are able to sit in a comfortable position. A quiet room, or under a tree. Some people prefer white noise, others prefer absolute silence. You'll learn works best for you through trying different things.

Sit in a comfortable position. Crossed legged on the floor or on a pillow is customary but feel free to sit on a chair, or on a bed. As long as you are comfortable enough to not need to have to re-adjust this will help with the process.
Focus on your breath and nothing else. Inhale through your nose and exhale through your mouth. Think about the air travelling into your body, and out.
Try to clear your mind. Inhale positive thoughts. Exhale negative thoughts.
Try to detatch from the material world. Focus on your natural self. If you find yourself thinking about the news, politics, or work, quickly exhale those thoughts and focus on a static nature scene.

If you find your mind wondering, guide yourself through a field or forest. Keep your thoughts as natural as possible. You will find your peace. You will find your calm. You deserve mindfulness and you will achieve it through practice and patience.

name: 8 funny GIFs for your mental health
author: Jake Martella
tags: mental health, funny, laughter, positivity, positive, stay positive, health, wellness, mindfulness

steps.step: Go for a walk. Even if it's raining or cold. Fresh air is good for the soul!
Exercise! Exercising releases endorphins and reduces stress.
Having proper posture helps self-esteem.
Hug people more. We are social creatures and thrive off love and affection.
Start writing in a gratitude journal. Showing appreciation for even the smallest things can help put things into perspective.
Get more rest. Sleep is a vital part your mental health.
Keep a positive mindset. What you think, you become.
Lastly and our personal favorite: Studies show just 10 minutes of petting a furry friend can reduce the stress hormone (cortisol).

name: 4 ways to seek therapy
author: CAMH
tags: mental health, funny, laughter, positivity, positive, stay positive, health, wellness, mindfulness

steps.step: Individual therapy with a accredited psychologist, psychiatrist or counsellor.
Group therapy sessions are a great way to open up to people going through similar things you may be. Sometimes it helps hearing other people's struggles to feel less alone.
Couples therapy is an important step in solving relationship problems. Trust and acceptance are key components to a healthy relationship.
Family therapy. Everybody needs a support system. Your family (or a friend) is a great place to start if you're feeling like you need help and can't do it alone.

name: 7 habits to help improve mental health
author: CAMH
tags: mental health, funny, laughter, positivity, positive, stay positive, health, wellness, mindfulness

steps.step: Eat healthy food.
Tune out distractions and negative energy by listening to music.
Join a sports program. This is great for mental health because it helps you get exercise as well as social connections.
Engage with others to feel connectedness and social affection.
Exercise increases your overall health and sense of well-being.  Exercise also produces endorphins, which is a 'feel-good' chemical in the brain.
Smoking and excessive alcohol can be harmful to your mental health, even if they seem to help as a remedy very briefly.

Turning off your phone and disconnecting can help you with mindfulness and living in the present moment. We can often get lost in our phones and spend too much time on social media or being available for work on off-hours.

name: 4 fun food hacks
author: Crafty Co
tags: food, hack, life-hacks, lifehacks, tricks, burger, sauce, hacks, clever, creative

steps.step: Having a party with cake? No need for forks or plates...
Has this happened to you opening pasta? Yeah. Us too.
Has this happened to you opening pasta? Yeah. Us too.
These sauce packets were not mean't for dipping burgers...
All you need is a toothpick, and voila!
Nobody likes messy fingers.
Nobody likes messy fingers.

name: How to make a fruit bowl
author: Anonymous
tags: food, hack, life-hacks, lifehacks, tricks, burger, sauce, hacks, clever, creative

steps.step: Draw dot on wooden skewer or dowel.
Drill holes thumbs length away from ends
Feed a wire through the hole as shown.
Using plyers, bend the wire to keep sticks from falling out.
Push the smaller ends down and the longer ends up to create a bowl shape.
Fill bowl with fruit and enjoy!

name: How to hang a picture
author: The DIY Guys
tags: diy, build, picture, hang, frame, drywall, stud, wall, anchor, drill, diy, home improvement

steps.step: Gather tools.
If you're unsure of where to position your picture, typically it's suggested to hang at eye level, although you can do whatever is comfortable for you.
Use a pipe and cable detector to check if the wall is clear for drilling into.
Once you find a safe spot, hold your photo and mark the top center with a pencil.
Measure the distance from the picture wire to the top of the frame, making sure to pull the wire taut.
Using your measurement, mark the wall where the wire would sit, adding a half inch to the top so that the picture will cover your top line marking when it hangs.
You can hold your picture above the top marking to get an idea of how it will look.
Follow these next instructions if you have plaster walls.
If your walls are plaster, you can use a simple anchor.
If you have masonry walls follow the next step.
You can use a plastic plug. Make sure your drill bit is slightly smaller in diameter than the plug. It's better to start too small than make a hole too big for the plug.
Use masking tape around your drill bit as a marker to see how deep the wall is.
Drill into the wall.
Use a hammer to tap the plug in all the way.
Screw into the stud and leave some space for your picture to hang.
If your picture is very heavy, you may need a different approach.
Use your stud finder to find a stud and mark with pencil.
Use a carpenters all to pierce into the wall and make sure a stud is there. Screw directly into the wall/stud. Remember to leave a bit of room for the picture to hang.
Hang your picture
Use a level to ensure the picture is straight, and you're done!

name: How to unclog your drain
author: Home Depot Official
tags: diy, build, picture, hang, frame, drywall, stud, wall, anchor, drill, diy, home improvement

steps.step: Use a clamp to keep dirty water from spilling out.
Make sure plunger is submerged in water. With firm pressure try to unclog drain.
Work until drain clears.
If plunger is unsuccessful, try cleaning the p-trap.
Loosen slip nuts.
Empty p-trap into a bowl.
Clear any potential blockages.
If the p-trap wasn't the problem, try removing the arm.
Clear any potential blockages from the arm.
If still unnsuccessful, try using a snake to clear blockages.
Reassemble and run hot water to clear out any other debris.
You're all done!

name: How to patch a hole in drywall
author: Home Depot Official
tags: diy, build, patch, hole, drywall, compound, diy, home improvement

steps.step: Score a square around the hole.
Cut a square around the hole.
Cut a square from another piece of drywall. You will use this piece to fill the hole.
Score the brown side of the drywall. Make the square roughly the same size as the square hole in the wall you just made. It should be small enough to find inside.
Break the sides of the drywall off where you scored the lines. Keep the paper attached though, you'll see why by step 10.
Remember to leave the paper edges on!
Add drywall joint compound (bucket mud) on the inside of the hole.
Cover the surrounding hole with compound.
Add compound to the edges of the drywall replacement piece.
Fit the drywall patch piece inside the hole with the white side facing you.
Tap into place.
Add compound overtop.
Cover the entire area with compound. Try and keep a firm pressure on the scraper to get clean smooth wipes. Let dry and add one more layer of compound.
After you finish the second coat and it has dried, sand smooth.

name: Easy microfoam from home
author: Coffee Crazers
tags: coffee, latte, cappucino, foam, microfoam, milk, french press, espresso, caffeine

steps.step: Pour milk into a french press.
Put the top on and pump the milk
Pour foam onto coffee, latte, cappucino or espresso.

name: How to keep lemons from drying out
author: 5-Minute Hacks
tags: lemon, lemons, fresh, fresh food, keep fresh, food hack, life hack

steps.step: Cut to sides of a pringles lid.
Attach a rubber band along the slits.
Place lemon with flesh side facing the lid.
Keep refrigerated.

name: Convenient garbge bin hack
author: 5-Minute Hacks
tags: garbage, trash, bin, bag, bags, roll, life hack

steps.step: Cut a slit in an empty paper towel roller. Feed a roll of bags through the slit.
Place at bottom of garbage bin and keep bags connected.
Simply tear away old bags and reset with next bag in line.

name: How to grate things safely
author: 5-Minute Hacks
tags: garbage, trash, bin, bag, bags, roll, life hack

steps.step: This is an example of what can happen when grating things by hand.
Use a chopstick and spear the potato (or cheese or onion etc whatever you're grating.)
Grate safely!

name: How to make brownies
author: Choco-Lovers
tags: food, brownies, bake, baking, chocolate, fudge, sweet

steps.step: Cut chocolate. Melt half and save half for later.
Melt butter.
Add sugar
Whisk until smooth.
Add 2 eggs.
Add vanilla
Whisk until smooth.
Add melted chocolate.
Add melted chocolate.
Mix.
Add chocolate chunks.
Place parchment paper in a baking pan and pour batter into a pan evenly.
Bake.
Let cool 5-10 minutes and then cut.
Enjoy!

name: How to clean your keyboard
author: Anonymous
tags: keyboard, pc, computer, mac, apple, clean, maintenance

steps.step: Remove batteries or/and unplug from power.
Start by flipping your keyboard upside down and lightly tapping out any loose debris.
Use a cotton swab with alcohol (just damp, not dripping) to wipe inbetween and underneath keys.
If there was debris/grime that the swab couldn't get. Try getting at it with a toothpick.
Use a cloth and wipe away any other surface dirt.

name: How to clean your phone
author: Anonymous
tags: keyboard, pc, computer, mac, apple, clean, maintenance

steps.step: Wipe away surface dirt with a clean microfiber cloth. Don't use paper towel.
Dampen the microfiber and clean thoroughly. When it comes to electronics, remember to turn off your phone when adding moisture into the cleaning process.
If you've been to the beach, wiping away sand can scratch the screen, so try a piece of scotch tape instead.
If you you know your phone is contaminated, try using a UV light to kill any surface bacteria.
Some phones are waterproof. It's still suggested to use a damp cloth instead of submerging your phone when cleaning.

name: How to clean your laptop
author: Anonymous
tags: keyboard, pc, computer, mac, apple, clean, maintenance

steps.step: Unplug and turn off your laptop.
Flip laptop upside down and tap out any loose debris.
Use tap to pick up any other surface debris.
Use disinfecting wipes to wipe away grime on the keys. Wring away any excess liquid from the wipes before using. Ideally the cloth is damp and not dripping.
Dry off with a microfiber cloth.
Use a fan to make sure every part of the computer is dry. Moisture can get under the keyboard and you shouldn't turn on your computer until everything is bone dry.
Now get back to work!

name: How to fix your blinds
author: Anonymous
tags: diy, build, picture, hang, frame, drywall, stud, wall, anchor, drill, diy, home improvement

steps.step: Attach a large paper clip the end of the broken blind.
Taping the paper clip to the broken edge of the blind.
Try to wrap the tape 2-3 times around so the paper clip is secure.
Using a knife, or anything sharp, poke a hole in the tape. This will create a hole the blind track can clip into.
Clip the blind into position.
You fixed your blinds!

name: How to varnish tricky places
author: Anonymous
tags: diy, build, picture, hang, frame, drywall, stud, wall, anchor, drill, diy, home improvement

steps.step: Some nooks and crannies are tricky to get to.
Put a plastic bag on your hand as a glove. Make sure there are no holes in the bag.
Put a sock on top of the plastic bag.
Add varnish to the sock. Your hand is now the brush.
Use your hand to get into the hard to reach places.

name: Make a paint brush holder
author: Anonymous
tags: diy, build, picture, hang, frame, drywall, stud, wall, anchor, drill, diy, home improvement

steps.step: Most people just toss the brush into the paint can.
Try this nifty trick. Get a strong magnet from your hardware store and attach it to the side of the can with the brush facing down.

steps.step: Cut a straw
Use straw as a brush
Let dry. Done!

name: No-curling iron hair curler

steps.step: Wet your hair
Use socks to roll your hair up.
Bundle all parts of your hair you want to curl.
Blow dry.
Remove socks and you're done!

name: Make a beauty product organizer
author: Anonymous
tags: hair, curl, curler, salon, beauty

steps.step: Use an empty cardboard box and cut off the arms.
Attach a second box on top with a glue gun.
Get wrapping paper or fabric with a design you like and cover boxes. You can staple, tape or glue gun depending on the material you choose.
Add frills and trim.
Add products and you're all done!

name: How to turn glossy nail polish matte
author: Anonymous
tags: hair, curl, curler, salon, beauty

steps.step: Paint your nails as you normally would.
Hold your hand above steam. Be very careful to not get too close as you could seriously injure yourself. Start from far away and slowly get closer to ensure you don't burn yourself.
Get wrapping paper or fabric with a design you like and cover boxes. You can staple, tape or glue gun depending on the material you choose.
